dlgLine.text: Do you need any guidance?

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
I could really use your support at our meetings.
So you say you found the shelter with divine help, did you?
Melina says you're trying to preach your faith to her.
Can I confess some sins to you?
Can I ask you a question?
I don't need anything right now. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: Yes, of course.

dlgAnsw.text: You mentioned the end times - why do you say that?
What happened on your way here?
What would you say your skills are?
What do you think would make this place better?
That's all for now. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Many religions - not just mine - tell of a day where the world ends. The dead coming back to life is specifically mentioned.

I know there are many passages of the Bible that are open to interpretation, but the resurrection of the dead is clearly a sign of Judgment Day. I feel that in the time remaining, we must be true to ourselves and prepare for what comes next.

dlgAnsw.text: I disagree - I don't believe in it. There's got to be a rational explanation.
How do you know it's Judgment Day? What if it's Ragnarok?
I see. I have another question...
That's enough for now. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Maybe. But, it can't hurt to be spiritually prepared for the worst, I'd say.

dlgAnsw.text: Let's change the subject.
We'll continue this conversation later.

dlgLine.text: If that's what you need to call it, why not. Ragnarok or Judgment Day, it's an event that signifies the end of the world. And we should be preparing our souls for when the last day comes.

dlgAnsw.text: Let's try another question.
I'll speak to you later.

dlgLine.text: I was travelling with a group of friends and associates. There were fifteen of us packed in the back of a limousine, stuck on the highway in traffic. After barely moving for almost an hour, we heard gunshots.

Our driver was shot immediately. There was a man with an assault rifle, walking around shooting at cars. He was shouting at drivers to get traffic going. People started to run from their cars - we joined them.

dlgAnsw.text: It's okay. Go on.
I've heard enough. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Some of the group were separated. Priscilla stayed at my side the whole time. We followed another group up the road for most of the day. Some time, at dawn, we heard screaming. The next moment, everyone was running.

Over the next week, our numbers went from dozens to a few. Many friends gave their lives to protect me. Soon it was only the two of us, lost on the road. And that's when God showed me the way. And here we are.

dlgAnsw.text: Why don't we talk about something else.
Thank you for telling me that. We'll talk more later.

dlgLine.text: I provide spirtual counseling. You could call me a Christian, but I'd prefer to think of spirituality as a nuanced and diverse expression of the soul. God speaks to us in many different ways, and I just want to help people to understand the message.

dlgAnsw.text: So, you're a preacher?
What I meant was, do you have any real skills?
Let's please change the subject.
Okay, that's all for now.

dlgLine.text: Maybe some might phrase it that way. That's a bit conventional. I've never been big on denomination - I just want to help us all channel our faith for the benefit of all mankind. Or this shelter, hopefully.

dlgAnsw.text: I see. Another question.
That's all I need to know right now. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Aside from my years of counseling, you mean? I have been know to tinker in the the old workshop once in a while. Good at birdhouses, and I dabble in restoring classic cars here and now. If that matters now.

dlgAnsw.text: Good to know. Another question, maybe?
Noted. I'll speak to you later about assignments.

dlgLine.text: I'd prefer the fence was stronger and maybe higher. I'd rather not see the dead. Looking out on all those faces. The congregation... I mean that the dead, they fill me with sorrow for the lives lost without salvation.

dlgAnsw.text: Let me ask you something else.
I'll see what I can do. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Yes, that's right. It was in our darkest time, after days of hiding from the dead, I heard a voice tell me to go North, and there it was - this school.

dlgAnsw.text: Bullshit. A cop told you. I know the truth, Todd.
Interesting story. Thanks for sharing. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: The truth? I... I like to think that God works through people. In our time of need, that officer showed up and pointed us in the right direction. Truly, God was looking out for Priscilla and me.

dlgAnsw.text: I think you're using your story for influence here. What if others knew the truth?
Maybe. But that's not how I'll tell it.
Maybe you're right. I just wish you had told me the facts.

dlgLine.text: I apologize. I don't really like to think about what happened to that kind man. He didn't deserve it. I say a prayer for him every night.
I hate to even think his body is still out there, wandering around. So... I try not to forget about him.

dlgAnsw.text: Really? Is that what you tell yourself?
Sorry to bring it up. I should go.
I'll make sure I put down any dead cops I see. Sorry - I'll leave you alone.

dlgLine.text: I'm not sure what you want me to say. What do you get from telling others about how I got here?

dlgAnsw.text: It's not what I get, it's what you lose - a good story. Who knows what they'll think?
I don't care. I just want them to think less of you.

dlgLine.text: What are you asking for? Are you trying to blackmail me? Over a different interpretation of events?

dlgAnsw.text: I want your support for my silence. Why risk it?
Todd... I don't like you. But I need you. So, let's help each other seem more honest to our friends here.

dlgLine.text: ...I will try to... to help you out when I can. I just don't want to hear you bring up that incident with anybody. Now, excuse me - I have some prayers to say.

dlgAnsw.text: Glad we understand each other. Good talk.
They better be about me, and how great of a leader I am. See ya.

dlgLine.text: I don't need much in the way of creature comforts, although I wouldn't mind rechargeable batteries for the portable radio that I use in my sermons. Although, I have had some trouble sleeping lately...

dlgAnsw.text: I have some rechargeable batteries here.
I have some sleeping pills, if they'll help.
I'll keep an eye out.

dlgLine.text: Well, I would be happy to support you, if you could see to donate a few items for our Sunday service. Some extra rations for a group meal in the cafeteria would go a long way toward promoting the spirit of unity, I feel.

dlgAnsw.text: How many extra rations?
I'm sorry - we can't spare any food for any reason.

dlgLine.text: Twenty or so, I think. It's a bit less than ideal, but food and socializing can really lift the spirit. I think it would be a good way for us to get to know each other a bit better.

dlgAnsw.text: Done. Just remember who helped you make it happen.
I can give you half. Any more than that and everybody asks me for special favors.
That's not going to happen. We need to ration everything carefully.

dlgLine.text: Oh, good. This bodes well for fostering a strong community here at the shelter. Thank you.

dlgAnsw.text: Of course. Help yourself - I've got something to take care of.
I expect a big swell in support from the faithful. Hint. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: That's unfortunate. I'd like you to think about it some more. Come talk to me if you have a change of heart.

dlgAnsw.text: Not likely. Bye, Todd.
How about you go pray for a fancy spread and I go risk my life for some canned stew. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: I can appreciate your situation. But I can't really provide for everyone for less than 12 rations worth of food. Can't really turn one loaf into ten, unlike some people - heh.

dlgAnsw.text: Very persuasive. I just hope you can help me persuade others here that I know what I'm doing.
No. That's too much. Sorry - I don't need the heat it will bring.

dlgLine.text: All I'm really concerned with is providing a comfortable environment for our fellow members. But, people talk during these gatherings, and I'm sure a few good words will be said about your generosity. Hope to see you there.

dlgAnsw.text: Good to hear. We'll talk later.
Oh, I expect it will. Just remember who's got your back. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Ah, now I don't have to worry about running out of music during the sermon. Thank you.

dlgAnsw.text: Glad I could help.
Enjoy. See ya.

dlgLine.text: I usually wouldn't rely on a drug to sleep, though it's probably important I'm rested for the morning prayer. Thank you.

dlgAnsw.text: Of course. See ya.
Hope it helps.

dlgLine.text: Yes, of course. I'm always willing to listen and help however I can.
What's weighing on you today?

dlgAnsw.text: I killed someone the other day...
I risked one of my men's lives needlessly in combat...
I took down one of those corpses...
I yelled at someone for no reason the other day...

dlgLine.text: Yes, go on.

dlgAnsw.text: ...It felt great...
...All I could think of was hamburgers...
...It's not getting easier...
...Reminded me of my father...
...Every time I think about it, I need to masturbate...

dlgLine.text: Yes...

dlgAnsw.text: ...Man, I'm awesome.
...I think I have a problem.
...What was I talking about?
...My hands just kill and kill.
...It's like this crisis brings out the real me.

dlgLine.text: I see... I think that admitting our problems is the first step to healing ourselves. I hope that you've found some self-perspective that will guide you in the future. I'll pray for you.
Lord, please help <charname> find understanding and relief, and guide them on the path of righteousness. Amen.
Please let me know if you ever need to talk about anything else.

dlgAnsw.text: <Todd goes back to praying for you.>

dlgLine.text: All I was doing was trying to get her to do was find some peace before her condition ends her life. I don't think there's anything wrong with that, and I hope you can appreciate it.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, I guess it's okay if you're trying to help her.
No, it's not okay. Leave her alone. Am I making myself clear?

dlgLine.text: Good - I'm glad you understand I'm just trying to make everyone face issues that we try not to think about, but often regret when it's too late. And that poor girl, with the condition she's in - I want to know that she's prepared when her time comes.

dlgAnsw.text: <Todd smiles and goes back to scanning his bible.>

dlgLine.text: I... If that's how you feel. I think you're making too much out of this. But, I'll leave her alone if you're going to bent out of shape about a few kind words.

dlgAnsw.text: <Todd scans his bible and stops talking to you.>
